episode_summary: Guest Olga Koch joins Dan, James, and Andy for four facts spanning music-industry showdowns with TLC, Japanese number-word puns behind Tokyo Skytree’s height, a proposal to rewet a 500‑mile belt of bogs to hinder Russian expansion while storing carbon, and the chaotic first online pizza delivery in 1994 that drew a press scrum and went awry. Along the way they detour through K‑/J‑pop, railway jingles, peatlands, and early e‑commerce origins.

facts.fact: My fact is that TLC held the head of their recording label, Clive Davis Hostage, in order to renegotiate their recording contract.
My fact this week is that the height of the world's third tallest structure was picked because it worked as a pun.
Okay, my fact this week is that one idea to block Russian expansion in Eastern Europe is to create a 500 mile long bog.
My fact is, when the first ever online pizza delivery was made, a hundred journalists turned up to report on it. The driver got lost.
